results.title: City on fire
results.creator_credit: Media Asia Distribution and Ringo Lam
results.brief_description: Charismatic Hong Kong film star Chow Yun Fat stars in Ringo Lam’s explosive action film about an undercover cop whose investigation into a series of jewelery robberies around Hong Kong draws him into a dangerous circle of new friends. He becomes buddies with a member of this gang (Danny Lee) and is soon involved in the gang’s next big heist. This is a classic example of the Hong Kong action film genre. (Awards: Winner of Best Director and Best Actor at the 7th Annual Hong Kong Film Awards) In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: City of God = Cidade de Deus
results.creator_credit: O2 Filmes, VideoFilmes Production, Andrea Barata Ribeiro, Mauricio Andrade Ramos and Fernando Meirelles
results.brief_description: Award winning cinema, this directorial masterpiece by Fernando Meirelles is violent, disturbing and skillful storytelling. The story unfolds in the slums of Rio de Janeiro’s “City of God”, a housing project built in the 1960s that becomes by the ‘80s a city engulfed by gang warfare. Based on a true story and a novel by Paulo Lins, young Busca-Pe (aka Rocket) grows up amongst this violence and we learn the history of the gangs through a series of stories told in flashback style with him as narrator. Rocket, through all of the horror, decides his own fate by becoming a photographer and his ability is his way out of the ‘City’. Gangsters, guns and violence are so accepted that they become the norm to a new and much younger generation happy to perpetuate the lifestyle learned from birth, reinforced by poverty. Nominated for four Academy Awards. In Portuguese with English subtitles. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: City lights
results.creator_credit: Charles Chaplin Productions and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: Chaplin once again revived the character of the Little Tramp for this, his last ‘silent’ film (save for a musical score and an occasional sound effect), released three years after the beginning of the talkie era. After falling in love with a blind flower girl who, through a series of coincidences comes to believes that he is a millionaire, the Tramp attempts to raise money for an operation to restore her vision. A melodrama that combines pathos with slapstick and comedy, ‘City Lights’ is widely regarded as Chaplin’s greatest film.

results.title: Cinema of vengeance
results.creator_credit: Vengeance Productions, George Tan and Robyn Russell
results.brief_description: A documentary on the history of Martial Arts in film, covering fifty years of Chinese action cinema from the late forties through to present day hi-tech action drama. “Cinema of Vengeance” features profiles of Jackie Chan, Jimmy Wang Yu, Bruce Li, Chow Yun-Fat, Gary Daniels, Samo Hung, Ti Lung, John Woo, Cynthia Rothrock, Don Wilson, Steve James, Mike Kelly and Joe Lewis. It also includes previously unseen footage and an exclusive interview with Bruce Lee.

results.title: Chuck & Buck
results.creator_credit: Flan de Coco Film, Matthew Greenfield and Miguel Arteta
results.brief_description: Chuck (Chris Weitz) and Buck (Mike White) were best friends as boys, but with the passing of time, Chuck has ended up a successful record executive in Los Angeles, while Buck has remained at home looking after his invalid mother. When the two of them meet at Buck’s mother’s funeral, Buck decides to follow his old friend to LA. But Chuck, now engaged and a professional, has little time for the nostalgic games that Buck wants to play. In order to win his old friend back, Buck stages a play at the theatre across the road from Chuck’s work. But the play - honest and fantastical, an adult fairytale - has far from the desired effect. Miguel Arteta’s film begins as an initially finely comic study of Buck, an innocent, unworldy man trapped in the fantasies of childhood. But increasingly, as his stalking of Chuck becomes obsessive and malignant, a darker tone appears in this film. Childhood games are revealed to be far from innocent: Buck wants to return to the playfulness of their sexual exploration when they were adolescent boys; but Chuck is fearful of the unresolved tensions and consequences of this early experimentation. Both Buck’s relentless refusal to be an adult, and Chuck’s equally fervent denial of his childhood sexuality lead to potentially dangerous consequences for both themselves and those around them. “Chuck and Buck” suggests it is only through the translating of his obsessions and fears into theatre, into drama and art, that Buck can find a way to release himself from the legacy of his childhood. For all its menace, “Chuck and Buck” allows the possibility not only for tolerance but an understanding to emerge between the old friends; an understanding not predicated on either false nostalgia or on denying the eroticism of friendship. The film also features some light-hearted affectionate satire about actors, auditions and the theatre world and features an excellent support performance by Lupe Ontiveros. Paul Weitz plays Chuck’s theatrical alter-ego. The film was shot on digital video format.

results.title: Chronicle of a love = Loving lie
results.brief_description: Antonioni’s highly acclaimed first film relates the tale of an adulterous wife and her impoverished lover who plan to murder her rich husband. He dies before they carry out the deed and they have to live with the guilt of their intentions. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Chocolat [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Oceania Produzioni Internazionali Cinematografiche, Cerito Films, La Sept, Alain Belmondo, Gerald Crosnier and Claire Denis
results.brief_description: Memories of a childhood in a remote part of the French Cameroons provides the basis for this subtle, partly autobiographical, portrait of a colonial society. France (a surrogate for the filmmaker), revisiting the Cameroons, flashes back to scenes of her youth when her father was a French colonial official. The precarious equilibrium of their household (the mother is attracted to a young black servant) is disturbed by the sudden arrival of a group of outsiders, both European and African, after the forced landing of their plane nearby. The sharpness of the observation and the performances - each of the outsiders represents a different perspective on Africa - prevents the film from sliding into easy nostalgia for a time and way of life long since past. Cast: Isaach de Bankole, Giulia Boschi, Francois Cluzet, Jean-Claude Adelin. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Chitty Chitty Bang Bang (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Warfield Productions, Dramatic Features, Albert R. Broccoli, Ken Hughes and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: The author of James Bond, Ian Fleming, wrote this charming story of a car that could fly. This is a wonderful musical/comedy fantasy for the whole family starring Dick Van Dyke and Gert Frobe. It is recreated for the screen by the director Ken Hughes of “Those Magnificent Men in Their Flying Machines”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Warfield Productions, Dramatic Features, Albert R. Broccoli, Ken Hughes and Ken Adam

results.title: Chinatown [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Long Road Productions, Robert Evans and Roman Polanski
results.brief_description: Chandleresque private eye J.J. Gittes takes on the seemingly routine investigation of an errant husband but is soon caught up in a network of private and public evil. Drought-stricken Los Angeles in 1937 is a disorienting and alien place. In this multi-layered narrative, marked by dark humour, the mysterious Chinatown, where social and moral norms don’t operate, acts as a metaphor for a pervasive corruption implicating the past, the present and the future. Stars John Huston, Jack Nicholson and Faye Dunaway. Also availble on VHS [302476].
